Having dedicated a substantial 3k hours across OW1 and OW2, I cannot  endorse OW2 in any capacity. The game's palpable lack of enjoyment is exacerbated by a pronounced flaw: the lamentable matchmaking. Blizz's alterations have rendered it a bad un-fun experience; matches sway between overpowering victories and devastating losses, with no equilibrium.

Had OW1 been preserved, myself and my friends within the OW community would've remained . Attaining the rank of masters in tank and support roles, my peak coincided with OW1's closure. Presently, the game teeters on the balance of death, and Blizzards endeavor to rejuvenate it via Steam is a lamentably at best.

Overwatch Returns Leaves Players Heartbroken

I don't even know where to begin â€“ Overwatch Returns is an absolute nightmare. I used to be an incredibly devoted fan of this game, but this so-called "return" is making me wish I could throttle the development team.

Firstly, what in the world were they thinking? They completely upended the character abilities, rendering all the previous tactics and strategies worthless. I spent so damn much time mastering each character's skills, and now they've all been changed. It's like they're mocking all my previous efforts. After the update, the game is an absolute mess, and there's no way to enjoy it anymore.

Secondly, the new gameplay mode is like the development team's brains have gone AWOL. They turned team battles into this shameless competitive garbage. This "innovative" mode only intensifies the hostility between players, and there's zero teamwork left. The previously well-defined roles for characters are now reduced to an ego-driven showdown â€“ it's a heartless betrayal of long-time players.

And then there's the game optimization, which is utter crap. Even on a top-tier computer, it lags like hell. What the hell is this? With such frequent updates, can't they spare a thought for optimization? It's like the development team couldn't care less.

In conclusion, Overwatch Returns has left me feeling exceptionally, incredibly, unbelievably, outrageously, overwhelmingly, extraordinarily, deeply, profoundly, extremely, intensely, monumentally, and utterly disappointed. All the enthusiasm I once had has been obliterated by their disastrous decisions time and time again. If the development team doesn't pull themselves together and deliver something remotely decent for the game soon, I'm seriously ditching this ship for good. Consider yourself warned â€“ don't waste any more time on this utterly ruined mess.
